data.title: Subrogation & Salvage Specialists
data.meta_description: Our Subrogation Recovery Specialists assure quick & efficient recoveries, offering highly competent Subrogation & Salvage Management Services in Michigan, USA
data.text:
Mr. Schram's vision for building a vehicle for purchasing subrogation claims launched Latitude Claims Services in 1997. Latitude Subrogation Services began in 1998 as the subrogation servicing vehicle for purchased claims. Mr. Schram is a practicing attorney and established the law firm of Hertz Schram PC in 1979, and has served as its President and largest shareholder since its incorporation in 1981. Mr. Schram has been involved with dozen of insurance related class action lawsuits defending director and officer liability actions. The law firm of Hertz Schram PC currently has 30 attorneys and specializes in securities law, real estate, banking, corporate and finance, estate planning and creditors rights. Mr. Schram is admitted to practice law in Michigan, Florida and Washington, D.C. Mr. Schram received a political science degree from the University of Michigan's Honors College. Mr. Schram spent six months in South America as a photojournalist for several U.S. newspapers before attending Georgetown University law Center in Washington, D.C. where he received his juris doctorate degree in 1976. Mr. Schram is actively involved in all operating aspects of the Latitude family of companies.

Mr. Ebling joined Latitude in June 2012. He brings with him a wealth of claims subrogation knowledge and experience acquired during his 25 year insurance industry career with Westfield Group and Nationwide Insurance companies. During that time he served as a Claims Representative, Trainer, Sr. Subrogation Specialist, Regional Subrogation Manager, and Business Project Management Consultant. Mr. Ebling earned his degree in Business Management and holds the designation of CSRP with NASP, and MCSA with Arbitration Forums. He has supervised various claims business units and the quality department for Latitude. His current area of responsibility is new client development, and fostering long-term client partnerships and affinity business relationships.

Mr. Bartoski joined Latitude in November 2021 and is responsible for establishing and executing the Information Technology (IT) vision and strategy. He is also accountable for IT operations, including network infrastructure, hardware, applications, business analysis, and reporting. Mr. Bartoski brings over 25 years of experience in IT operations, data analytics, program management, application development, process automation, budget management, contracting, and vendor management. Mr. Bartoski previously provided enterprise digital transformation solutions involving cloud, on-premises, and hybrid designs as a Technology Strategist at Microsoft Corporation. Before joining Microsoft, Mr. Bartoski served as the Executive Director of Information Technology at Detroit Public Schools. In this role, he made substantial improvements to the IT infrastructure, implemented a comprehensive cybersecurity strategy, automated business processes, transformed the IT department’s culture, improved end-user customer service, introduced collaboration and data analytics tools, and reduced wasteful spending. Mr. Bartoski has a B.S. degree in Computer Engineering from Oakland University and holds certifications in Microsoft Azure and Cisco Systems Network Administration.

Jim Wilds joined LSS in 2020 as an Executive Consultant. His insurance career spans over 40 years at Allstate, USF&G, Reliance and Frankenmuth Insurance from where he retired as a Senior Vice President of Claims and member of it's board of directors. He is a graduate of Michigan State University and during his insurance career earned industry designations of CPCU, SCLA, Registered Professional Adjuster (RPA), AIM, ARM, CIC, Certified Fraud Examiner (CFE), and Mutual Director Certificate (MDC). In addition to his claims and subrogation focus, throughout his career, he was very active in legislative and governmental affairs serving as Chairman of the Claims Committee of the Michigan Property and Casualty Guaranty Association (MPCGA), and the Michigan Catastrophic Claims Association (MCCA.) He also served as chairman of the board for the Insurance Institute of Michigan (IIM) and as a member of the board of directors at the Michigan Chamber of Commerce, the National Association of Mutual Insurance Companies (NAMIC), and the Saginaw Chapter of the American Red Cross. Jim Wilds was inducted into the Michigan Insurance Hall of Fame in 2010 and in 2016 received the NAMIC Merit Award in recognition of his exemplary efforts and professionalism in the property and casualty insurance industry. He currently serves on the Olivet College Insurance and Risk Management Advisory Board and the MI Insurance Hall of Fame board of directors.

Ms. Byrd joined Latitude Subrogation Services in March 2015 as a Subrogation Specialist and was quickly promoted to Claims Supervisor. Ms. Byrd brings over 25 years of experience in the collection agency industry. The vast majority of her experience was as an executive overseeing the day-to-day operations for an agency that was born to service the insurance industry with their uninsured auto claims. During her tenure with Latitude, she has supervised several business units within the organization; Auto Subrogation, Uninsured, Salvage and Restitution Teams, as well as files being handled by our outside collection vendor and auto fire expert. Ms. Byrd is currently a Claims Manager providing leadership to our Auto Subrogation, Arbitration and Salvage Teams. Ms. Byrd holds a designation as a Certified Subrogation Recovery Professional (CSRP) with NASP.

Mr. Bland joined Latitude Subrogation Services in June 2022 and is responsible for overseeing the Quality and Mining departments. He brings with him a wealth of claims knowledge, experience, and leadership acquired over his more than 20-year career in the insurance and financial services industries. Prior to joining Latitude, Mr. Bland spent 17 years in various claims roles with State Farm Insurance, including Auto Claims, Property Claims, Casualty/Liability Claims, and Subrogation Recovery, Litigation, and Arbitration claims. He has experience leading in operations excellence management, process improvement, business analysis, and quality assurance areas. He also has financial advisor and analyst experience, previously holding the Series 7 and 63 licenses and Registered Investment Advisor designation. Mr. Bland has a B.B.A. degree in Finance from Middle Tennessee State University where he was a member of Gamma Iota Sigma (GIS) professional fraternity for students pursuing careers in Insurance, Risk Management, and Actuarial Sciences. He also is an alumnus of Purdue University where he completed the post graduate program in Business Analysis, and he holds various insurance industry designations including the Certified Subrogation Recovery Professional (CSRP) with NASP, the Chartered Life Underwriter (CLU) with The American College, and the Certified Automobile Subrogation Arbitrator (CASA) with Arbitration Forums.

Jon Coscia, CSRP, President and Chief Executive Officer of Latitude Subrogation Services, holds an Associate Degree in Criminal Justice from Schoolcraft College, in Livonia, MI and a Certified Subrogation Recovery Professional designation from the National Association of Subrogation Professionals.

He currently oversees all areas of company operations including sales and marketing, strategic planning, accounting, business unit operations, claims, information technology, human resources, and employee development.

Mr. Coscia has held the positions of Claims Adjuster, Claims Supervisor, Claims Manager with a national insurance carrier, and brings with him over 25 years of subrogation, claims management and leadership experience.

He is the Associate Dean of the School of Claims Performance through the International Insurance Institute and has served as both board member and Vice President of the Claims Education Conference since 2014.

Mr. Coscia is Sr. Content Consultant to Claims Professional Books Online and is the author of the highly acclaimed book, Awesome Claims Customer Service–Part 1 which was the #1 selling claims book for 2021, and has sold internationally throughout the United States, Canada, Australia, England, and 9 other countries.

He has been featured in numerous periodicals as well as the lead story entitled, Living By Core Values in the 2016 Winter issue of Claims Education Magazine.

Mr. Coscia is co-author of the Emplyee Development management course offered through III, and his article entitled, Employee Education and Development outlines many of his respected tips on tapping employee talent.

He is an active board member of National Association of Subrogation Professionals serving as Treasurer and is chair of the Technology committee. He is also a current member of PLRB and NAMIC.

Sheila oversees Claim Support, Finance/Accounting, Human Resources, Information Technology, Quality and Training

As the previous leader of the National Recovery and Special Investigation organization at Nationwide Insurance, Sheila has overseen associate and leader development, strategic direction, policy implementation, fiscal management, and vendor relations.

Sheila holds a Bachelor’s and master’s degree in Business Administration from the University of Phoenix. Her accomplishments include being a Certified Subrogation Recovery Professional and a graduate of The Ohio State University Lean Leader Academy.

Sheila’s commitment to the industry extends beyond her professional achievements. She previously served on the non-profit board of the National Association of Subrogation Professionals (NASP) and currently serves as Chair for the NASP Executive Advisory Committee.

Ms. Smith, a C.P.A., joined Latitude in November 2019. She brings with her over thirty years of experience in the public accounting arena. She was previously a shareholder with Rubenfaer & Associates, P.C., a local MI CPA firm. Ms. Smith holds a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration degree, with a major in accounting, from Central Michigan University. She is a member of both the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants and the Michigan Association Certified Public Accountants. Her current area of responsibility is providing leadership for the accounting team along with overseeing company financial information, both internally and with external business partners.

Mrs. Williams began her career at Latitude as a Subrogation Specialist in 2006. She transitioned to the Arbitration Department, quickly being promoted to a Senior Arbitration Specialist and then to the Auto/Arbitration Team Lead in 2016. In September of 2017, she was promoted to Claims Supervisor. She has more than 30 years of claims and subrogation experience, beginning her insurance career at Farmers Insurance in 1989. Throughout her career, Mrs. Williams has successfully filed, or supervised the filing, of thousands of arbitration cases through Arbitration Forums, the Kentucky Arbitration Association and the NAMIC Arbitration Service, in all forums and in every state. She has been a Certified Arbitrator for Arbitration Forums since 2001 and continues to volunteer to hear cases on a monthly basis. Currently, she is responsible for overseeing the Arbitration and Auto Subrogation Departments. Mrs. Williams holds a designation as a Certified Subrogation Recovery Professional (CSRP) with NASP, as well as Auto and Special arbitration certifications with Arbitration Forums.

Ms. Fanse joined Latitude in December 2021 as an Accountant and was later promoted to Accounting Supervisor. She has over 8 years of experience in accounting, auditing, system implementation and internal controls. She previously worked as an Accountant in the real-estate and hospitality sector. Ms. Fanse holds a B.S. in Accounting with a major in Financial Accounting and Auditing. She is a Chartered Accountant from India and has passed the Uniform Certified Public Accountant Examination from the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants.

In 2023, Mr. Ignatonis joined Latitude Subrogation Services as a Workers Compensation Claims Supervisor, leveraging his 18-year background in leadership and claims. His extensive experience as an accomplished insurance professional and adept people manager encompasses workers compensation, disability, and property and casualty claims as well as managing teams of 5 to 150. Prior to his current role, he held a managerial position where he provided his expertise to risk management, TPA’s and leadership teams across diverse industries. His consistent track record of accomplishments shines through progressive roles, particularly excelling in aspects like streamlined claim processing, delivering exceptional client service, effective human capital management, and operational efficiency, all grounded in a proactive approach to executional excellence.
